data.title: Fahrenheit 451
data.meta_description: Anyone have a link to the unrecorded music from this film by Bernard Herrmann? I believe there is a video of live players.
data.text:
Fahrenheit 451 (1966)

Enterprise-Vineyard Productions [Universal Pictures]

Directed by Francois Truffaut.

Initial Publisher: Hawaii Music [BMI]

Xerographic photocopy on resin-coated paper of part of the manuscript full score in Bernard Herrmann's autograph, unbound. Herrmann used this as a working copy in assembling the final version of the full score.

"The Corridor" (this cue was cut from the film):

Video:

http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoid=2033571115

Fahrenheit 451

The Corridor (

There are two more videos from this recording sessions.

IV/A. The Giant Crab

http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoid=20234798

I/H III/A. The Balloon

http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&VideoID=8943540

.

I believe Paul has the entire score of Vertigo in his possession... [H]

Fahrenheit 451 is definitely one of Herrmann's best. Though having just watched Hangover Square, I was thinking THAT is one of his best. Each of his scores seems to be one of his best. He wrote the most perfect film music of any composer who ever lived, in addressing exactly what the film needed at any given moment, but also being artistically brilliant as pure music, as in the case of Vertigo which is some of the best music of any kind written at that time.
